page.title: 11RELIGION IN SHALBOURNE
page.content: Christianity has been the only reli- gion of note here in the past 1,000 years. The parish church,{St Michael {and All Angels,}dates back to about 1208. Another church once existed at the bottom of Rivar Road: only a few stones remain. Two{19th century {Methodist Chapels}are no longer in use. There are a few Roman Catholics and some Methodists, but most other villagers are either committed or nominal members of The Church of England. The Parish of Shalbourne is now linked with 7 other local parishes in the{Wexcombe Team. }Revd Michael Ward, parish priest, is also the Rector of the Wexcombe Team. Services are held each Sunday and at major festivals, including Holy Communion, Matins and Evensong. Special services are held at Christmas, Epiphany, Good Friday, Harvest and Remembrance Sunday
